I am post menopausal and recently my Skin Specialist gave me a Vitamin D blood test as it is essential for promoting calcium absorption in your gut.  My reading was sub 40_ which was very low_ but also highly unusual as I get lots and lots of sunshine (I own a farm and work outdoors most of the day without sunscreen!) and also I eat lots of fresh eggs and tinned tuna and salmon.  If anyone should have high D_ I should.  The only thing we can come up with is my 9 months of Xenical which would have inhibited the absorption of vitamin D as it is fat absorbed and Xenical was getting rid of any excess fat I was intaking.  18 months after ceasing Xenical_ I'm now thinking it may still be inhibiting my absorption of vitamin D.  Who knows?  I'm just throwing it out there as a possible side effect and I would suggest post menopausal women who have taken Xenical for a while_ have their vitamin D levels checked to make sure they're OK for absorbing calcium - hopefully to avoid osteoporosis.
